photo-caption: This is the gag which won me to the West Wing. It’s a tiny little thing: both Toby and Sam feel like their writing has become listless and by the numbers. For a completely unrelated reason, Leo assigns Sam with a piece of writing which should be far below his pay grade (and definitely outside his division): write a birthday message for the President to send to the Assistant Transportation Secretary on his/her 50th birthday. You can watch how writing something so mundane gets Sam’s writing wheels spinning again, and here Toby joins in, both realizing that they’re conning themselves out of their writing block. It’s only brought up in a handful of scenes, but it’s a lovely glimpse of two professionals working through a problem many of us have faced.
